recipe_name: Celeriac and carrot soup with watermelon and pineapple salsa
author: Trish Deseine
method: Bring the stock to the boil in a large saucepan. Add the vegetables and bouquet garni. Simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the vegetables are soft. While the vegetables are cooking, mix together all the salsa ingredients in a bowl. Set aside in the fridge to let the flavours develop.  When the vegetables are soft, remove the bouquet garni and blend with a stick-blender until the soup is very smooth. Add the cream, if using, and season with salt and pepper.  Serve in warmed bowls or little cups, topped with a little salsa.
ingredients: 1 litre/1¾ pint vegetable stock,  1 celeriac, approximately 500g/1lb 2oz, roughly chopped,  300g/10½oz carrots, roughly chopped,  ½ leek, trimmed and chopped,  bouquet garni,  50–100ml/2–3½fl oz double cream (optional),  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  300g/10½oz watermelon, seeds and rind removed, finely chopped,  ½ red onion, finely chopped,  6 cherry tomatoes, finely chopped,  200g/7oz pineapple, flesh finely chopped,  small bunch chives, finely chopped
